oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1952-03-22 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 22, 1952. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Williams (host/performer), guest performer Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, the Old Hickory Singers, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that Ernest Tubb will be hosting the show the following week.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Williams; Rod Brasfield; Old Hickory Singers; Hank Thompson; Brazos Valley Boys; Tommy Jackson; Lew Childre
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Williams -- Honky Tonk Blues (Hank Williams) -- Opening statement (Hank Williams, Grant Turner) -- Hank Williams introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Hank Williams) -- Prince Albert commercial (Hank Williams, Grant Turner) -- Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- Hank Williams introduces Hank Thompson -- The Wild Side Of Life (Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys) -- Hank Williams introduces Tommy Jackson and Lew Childre -- Boil Them Cabbage Down (Tommy Jackson fiddle), Lew Childre calls) -- Hank Williams talks -- Let The Spirit Descend (Hank Williams)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Brasfield, Rod; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Thompson, Hank; Brazos Valley Boys; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Jordanaires (Musical group); Williams, Hank, 1923-1953
